activities: Edwards receives human resources information regarding its EEA and Swiss employees for centralized record-keeping and processing in the United States. Edwards also receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers, and healthcare professionals all in support of Edwards' clinical research operations and its evaluation and reporting of potential adverse events. Furthermore, Edwards also receives personal information about its customers and online visitors in both electronic and manual form from the EEA and Switzerland to carry out a variety of business-related activities, such as customer service, health-information services, marketing and product development, distribution and quality monitoring.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources data; Clinical trial and adverse event data; Customer data; Data regarding online visitors.  These include electronic and manually-processed data.
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
